Mental Boxes

it occurs to me in hesitation that the circle spins forever something about an exit seems so unbroken so deep so explosive and we are only at the window cheeks pressed against the glass in wait for this freedom so pale so tired so unsatisfying when everything seems empty and the mirror draws blood I am lost in these mental boxes the labyrinth of dull desire and I am with you on this gentle slope the slow motion of small disaster this is only a physical distance remember that we smile at the same sun there is no peace here that I did not raise from chaos I imagine it is the same for you

By Krister Axel on 09/22 2003 at 11_36 in Poetry
